summary.para: Removes the indexing from a JPEG that has been indexed using .
Retrieves a copy of the compressed JPEG scan directly from the WIC decoder frame's output stream.

param.name: scanIndex
param.para: Type: UINT
The zero-based index of the scan for which data is retrieved.

param.name: scanOffset
param.para: Type: UINT

The byte position in the scan data to begin copying. Use 0 on the first call. If the output buffer size is insufficient to store the entire scan, this offset allows you to resume copying from the end of the previous copy operation.

param.name: cbScanData
param.para: Type: UINT
The size, in bytes, of the pbScanData array.

param.name: pbScanData
param.para: Type: BYTE*
A pointer that receives the table data. This parameter must not be NULL.

param.name: pcbScanDataActual
param.para: Type: UINT*
A pointer that receives the size of the scan data actually copied into pbScanData. The size returned may be smaller that the size of cbScanData. This parameter may be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The specified scan index is invalid.

summary.para: Retrieves a value indicating whether this decoder supports indexing for efficient random access.

param.name: pfIndexingSupported
param.para: Type: BOOL*
True if indexing is supported; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Indexing is only supported for some JPEG types. Call this method

summary.para: Retrieves a copy of the AC Huffman table for the specified scan and table.

param.name: scanIndex
param.para: Type: UINT
The zero-based index of the scan for which data is retrieved.

param.name: tableIndex
param.para: Type: UINT
The index of the AC Huffman table to retrieve. Valid indices for a given scan can be determined by retrieving the scan header with .

param.name: pAcHuffmanTable
param.para: Type: DXGI_JPEG_AC_HUFFMAN_TABLE*
A pointer that receives the table data. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The specified scan index is invalid.
Can occur if pAcHuffmanTable is NULL or if tableIndex does not point to a valid table slot. Check the scan header for valid table indices.

summary.para: Retrieves a copy of the DC Huffman table for the specified scan and table.

param.name: scanIndex
param.para: Type: UINT
The zero-based index of the scan for which data is retrieved.

param.name: tableIndex
param.para: Type: UINT
The index of the DC Huffman table to retrieve. Valid indices for a given scan can be determined by retrieving the scan header with .

param.name: pDcHuffmanTable
param.para: Type: DXGI_JPEG_AC_HUFFMAN_TABLE*
A pointer that receives the table data. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The specified scan index is invalid.
Can occur if pTable is NULL or if tableIndex does not point to a valid table slot. Check the scan header for valid table indices.

summary.para: Retrieves header data from the entire frame. The result includes parameters from the Start Of Frame (SOF) marker for the scan as well as parameters derived from other metadata such as the color model of the compressed data.

param.name: pFrameHeader
param.para: Type: *
A pointer that receives the frame header data.

summary.para: Retrieves a copy of the quantization table.

param.name: scanIndex
param.para: Type: UINT
The zero-based index of the scan for which data is retrieved.

param.name: tableIndex
param.para: Type: UINT
The index of the quantization table to retrieve. Valid indices for a given scan can be determined by retrieving the scan header with .

param.name: pQuantizationTable
param.para: Type: DXGI_JPEG_QUANTIZATION_TABLE*
A pointer that receives the table data. This parameter must not be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The specified scan index is invalid.
Can occur if pTable is NULL or if tableIndex does not point to a valid table slot. Check the scan header for valid table indices.

summary.para: Retrieves parameters from the Start Of Scan (SOS) marker for the scan with the specified index.

param.name: scanIndex
param.para: Type: UINT
The index of the scan for which header data is retrieved.

param.name: pScanHeader
param.para: Type: *
A pointer that receives the frame header data.

summary.para: Enables indexing of the JPEG for efficient random access.

param.name: options
param.para: Type:
A value specifying whether indexes should be generated immediately or deferred until a future call to .

param.name: horizontalIntervalSize
param.para: Type: UINT
The granularity of the indexing, in pixels.

remarks.para: This method enables efficient random-access to the image pixels at the expense of memory usage. The amount of memory required for indexing depends on the requested index granularity. Unless SetIndexing is called, it is much more efficient to access a JPEG by progressing through its pixels top-down during calls to .

This method will fail if indexing is unsupported on the file. should be called to first determine whether indexing is supported. If this method is called multiple times, the final call changes the index granularity to the requested size.

The provided interval size controls horizontal spacing of index entries. This value is internally rounded up according to the JPEG’s MCU (minimum coded unit) size, which is typically either 8 or 16 unscaled pixels. The vertical size of the index interval is always equal to one MCU size.
Indexes can be generated immediately, or during future calls to to reduce redundant decompression work.

summary.para: Exposes methods for decoding JPEG images. Provides access to the Start Of Frame (SOF) header, Start of Scan (SOS) header, the Huffman and Quantization tables, and the compressed JPEG JPEG data. Also enables indexing for efficient random access.

remarks.para: Obtain this interface by calling on the Windows-provided interface for the JPEG decoder.
